title: Convicted rapist David Gundari arrested after going on the run in Northern Territory
text:
A convicted rapist who once blamed his actions on an Aboriginal curse has been arrested in the Northern Territory more than five days after failing to appear in a Western Australian court.

Katherine Police arrested David Gundari overnight in relation to alleged weapons and other offences committed in the town last month and outstanding arrest warrants dating back to 2005.

But Gundari was also wanted by WA detectives after failing to appear at Wyndham Court in the Kimberley last Thursday accused of breaching his post sentence supervision order.

In two separate incidents, Gundari attacked and raped a 24-year-old French woman and a 32-year-old Japanese woman after dragging them into secluded areas of Broome late at night (file image)

The order was a condition of his release from prison last November after serving 12 years and included a curfew, urine tests for banned illicit substances and alcohol, a ban on licensed venues and that he attend programs and counselling.

Gundari, a Ngarringman-Moolybutta man, blamed his actions of brutally beating, raping and threatening to kill two foreign tourists in Broome in 2006 on an Aboriginal curse imposed over a woman's death in a remote community.

The then 32-year-old also told a court he would be speared in the leg as traditional punishment.

In two separate incidents, Gundari attacked and raped a 24-year-old French woman and a 32-year-old Japanese woman after dragging them into secluded areas of Broome late at night.

The French woman lost four front teeth and fractures to her face during her battering and the Japanese woman was knocked unconscious and raped while still out cold.

The arrest of Gundari in Katherine relates to charges of going armed in public; damage to property and riotous behaviour in a public place.

He is due to appear in Katherine Local Court on Thursday.
description: David Gundari was arrested by Katherine Police in the Northern Territory after he had been on the run for five days in relation to alleged weapons and other offences.
